alert.note: Alert for Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 6:37PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Scotts Bluff, western Cheyenne, Kimball, southwestern Morrill, Banner, southwestern Sioux, southeastern Goshen and northeastern Laramie Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 537 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Yoder to 9 miles south of Kimball Airport. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Torrington, Kimball, Gering, Mitchell, Terrytown, Pine Bluffs, Morrill, La Grange, Lyman, Potter, Dix, Albin, Yoder, Oliver Campground, Wildcat Hills State Recreation Area, Stegall, Panorama Point, Wildcat Hills Campground and Hawk Springs. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 399 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska...and southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux
